intro: Xylopleurum drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's woodpecker tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant has a distinctive, gnarled trunk and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that help reduce water loss. Xylopleurum drummondii plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various native fauna.
